meanings.definition: The act of broadcasting or transmitting on television or radio.
meanings.sent1: The TV station scheduled the airings of the new show for prime time.
meanings.sent2: I missed the airings of my favorite program last night.
meanings.sent3: The airings of the weather forecast always make me want to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: The airings of the news brought important information to the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The airings of the sports event drew a large audience to their screens.

meanings.definition: The exposure of something to the air.
meanings.sent1: The airings of the laundry on the clothesline helped them dry quickly.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the bread dough for airings allowed it to rise properly.
meanings.sent3: The airings of the fresh flowers made the room smell delightful.
meanings.sent4: The airings of the room after painting helped get rid of the strong smell.
meanings.sent5: The airings of the houseplants near the window kept them healthy and vibrant.

meanings.sent1: The singer's airings at the concert were well received by the audience.
meanings.sent2: The actor's airings in the play showcased his talent.
meanings.sent3: The airings of the magician's tricks amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The airings of the dance group brought joy to the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The airings of the comedian's jokes had everyone laughing out loud.
